page.title: 06THORRINGTON'S FARM L.MARNEY
page.content: The farm belongs to Mr. & Mrs. C. G. Coe and Mr. & Mrs. K.Coe. The house was built in the 16th century. The farm was bought from the Round Estate in 1955 - it was rented before this by their parents - and the brothers were born there. They get up at 5.45, feed the animals then they milk the cows at 6.00 am. At 7.30 am they have their breakfast. They work until dark but if the weather's bad they have to stop. There is no other help. They have 100 acres of pasture. It is a dairy and sheep farm. They have 45 cows, 15 bullocks, 320 sheep,13 rams,500 lambs, 2 ponies and 2 horses,5 dogs,3 cats. They go to the Colchester market for sheep and Chelmsford for cattle. They buy and sell their animals. They have 4 tractors, 2 hay turners, 1 grass cutter, 1 baler, 1 lorry and 1 forage harvester.There are remains of a moat.
